title: Turks and Caicos Islands - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: Police Forces of Turks and Caicos (2016-)
Coast of Providenciales and West Caicos
On 28 December 2020, off the Coast of Providenciales and West Caicos, the coast guard intercepted a boat with 26 Haitian refugees and towed them to the coast at South Dock.
Police Forces of Turks and Caicos (2016-)
Coast of Providenciales and West Caicos
On 16 October 2020, off the Coast of Providenciales and West Caicos, Providenciales and West Caicos, the coast guard stopped a vessel with 54 Haitian refugees on board and detained them.
Police Forces of Turks and Caicos (2016-)
Coast of Providenciales and West Caicos

On 9 October 2020, off the Coast of Providenciales and West Caicos, Providenciales and West Caicos, the coast guard intercepted a boat with more than 200 Haitian refugees. They were detained and repatriated.
Police Forces of Turks and Caicos (2016-)
Coast of Providenciales and West Caicos
On 20 September 2020, off the Coast of Providenciales and West Caicos, Providenciales and West Caicos, police forces intercepted a boat with 124 Haitian migrants and detained them.

On 25 June 2020, in Providenciales, Providenciales and West Caicos, taxi drivers picketed outside of the office of the Prime Minister to ask that the stimulus payment that was promised them be paid. [size=no report]

On 19 June 2020, in Providenciales, Providenciales and West Caicos, scores of people took to the street to protest against gun violence and delay in pay out of stimulus grants. The residents of the islands decried the increase in violent crime and the perceived lack of action by the police. [size=scores]
Police Forces of Turks and Caicos (2016-)
On 1 June 2020, off Providenciales, 129 Haitian migrants on a sloop were intercepted by the Turks and Caicos Police Force.
Police Forces of Turks and Caicos (2016-)
On 31 May 2020, off Providenciales, 135 Haitian migrants aboard a sloop were intercepted by the Turks and Caicos Police Forces.

On 24 March 2020 throughout the Turks and Caicos Islands the airports and sea ports were closed to all incoming travelers. On 26 March 2020 a curfew was imposed, and on 28 March 2020 this curfew was extended. These measures were imposed to prevent the spread of coronavirus.
Police Forces of Turks and Caicos (2016-)

On 28 and 30 January 2020, off the coast of Providenciales, two boats carrying 243 Haitian migrants were apprehended by the Royal TCI Police Force Marine Branch. The migrants were detained and taken to the port for processing by TCI immigration officials.

On 25 October 2019, in Providenciales city, Turks and Caicos, the employees of air traffic control went on strike at the international airport and demonstrated with placards demanding better working conditions. At the same time, a group of Opposition members stood in solidarity with them and demonstrated in the Grace Bay district of the same city. [size=no report]
Police Forces of the United Kingdom (2010-) Prison Guards

On 24 January 2019, in Cockburn Town, Grand Turk, Turks and Caicos, a group of prisoners staged violent activities for 3 hours in Her Majesty_ Prison demanding that they would be taken to their court hearings, which is reported as a longer standing problem. The Prison Superintendent and other guards were attacked with rocks and other objects. Furniture and cameras were broken by the fights. [size=no report]
Police Forces of Turks and Caicos (2016-)
Coast of Providenciales and West Caicos
On 11 September 2018, at the Coast of Providenciales and West Caicos, police forces arrested 111 Haitian migrants in the sea. The migrants were handed over to the Operation Guardian task force.
On 16 April 2018, in Providenciales, Providenciales and West Caicos, taxi drivers continued a demonstration at the Providenciales airport to denounce unfair competition. [size=no report].
On 15 April 2018, in Providenciales, Providenciales and West Caicos, taxi drivers started a 2-day demonstration at the Providenciales airport to denounce unfair competition. [size=no report].
